translation: atak, napad [a short period of illness or involvement in an activity]
sentence: He suffered from periodic bouts of insanity.

translation: stukać, klekotać [to make continuous loud noises by hitting hard objects against each other, or to cause objects to do this]
sentence: Don’t clatter the pots and pans – you’ll wake the baby up.

translation: bystry, przenikliwy [having a good understanding of a particular subject and the ability to make good judgments about it]
sentence: Simon has a clear-sighted vision of the company's future.

translation: szczepienie [the action of giving someone a weak form of a disease as protection against it, or something such as an injection that is given in this way]
liczny [literary; consisting of many things or parts]
sentence: The performers displayed their multitudinous talents.

translation: podstęp, fortel [formal; a trick or a dishonest way of achieving something]
sentence: It was clear that they must have obtained the information by subterfuge.

translation: próżny [that does not produce the result you want; (disapproving) too proud of your own appearance, abilities, or achievements]
sentence: He was very vain about his hair and his clothes.

translation: gwałtownie [in a strong and emotional way]
sentence: The president has vehemently denied having an extra-marital affair.

translation: winnica [a piece of land on which vines are grown]
sentence: They are also fond of grapes and other fruits, and are thus the pests of the vineyard as well as the poultryyard.

translation: ziewać [to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored]
sentence: I can't stop yawning - I must be tired.
